info.name: FoodMission Shopping List API
info.description:
Collection for FoodMission Shopping List API endpoints.

**IMPORTANT:** Make sure the `base_url` variable is set to `http://localhost:3000` (or your backend server URL) in your Postman environment. Do NOT use a frontend URL (like localhost:5173 or localhost:4200).

The API uses the global prefix `/api/v1`, so all endpoints are under `/api/v1/...`

**Note:** Users can have multiple shopping lists with different titles. A shopping list with the same title cannot be created twice for the same user.

request.description:
Creates a new shopping list for the authenticated user. Users can have multiple shopping lists with different titles. If a shopping list with the same title already exists for the user, returns a 409 Conflict error. Requires user or admin role.

**Rate Limit:** 5 requests per minute

**Required fields:**
- `title` (string, max 255 chars): The name/title of the shopping list

**Response:**
- Returns the created shopping list with `id`, `userId`, and `title`
- The `id` is automatically saved to `shopping_list_id` variable for use in other requests
Retrieves all shopping lists. This is a public endpoint. Returns a list of all shopping lists.
Retrieves a specific shopping list by ID. Only the shopping list owner can access it. Requires user or admin role.
Retrieve items for a shopping list with optional filters (foodId, checked, unit). Requires user or admin role.
Updates the shopping list title. Only the shopping list owner can update it. Requires user or admin role.
Deletes a specific shopping list by ID. All shopping list items will be deleted as well (cascade delete). Requires user or admin role.

variable.description: Backend API server URL. Must be the NestJS backend (default: http://localhost:3000). Do NOT use a frontend URL.
JWT access token (set automatically from Auth API collection)
User ID from the authenticated user profile (set automatically from Auth API collection)
Shopping List ID (automatically set after creating a shopping list)
